chemaxon.marvin.applet
Class MSpaceApplet

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      chemaxon.marvin.applet.MSpaceApplet
All Implemented Interfaces:
chemaxon.marvin.util.ParentPanelIface, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class MSpaceApplet
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements chemaxon.marvin.util.ParentPanelIface

MarvinSpace applet support.

Since:
MarvinSpace 1.0
Author:
Judit Vasko-Szedlar, Miklos Vargyas

readPropertyFile

public void readPropertyFile(java.lang.String filename,
                             float isoValue)
Reads a property file (Charmm format), and creates isocontour surfaces. The isocontour surface representing negative values will be colored red, while the other surface representing positive values will be blue.

Parameters:
filename - file, url or relative location to the codebase
isoValue - initial threshold value to create isocontour surfaces

mapPropertyFile

public void mapPropertyFile(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String surfacetype,
                            float min,
                            float max)
Computes an arbitrary type molecular surface, loads the given property file, colors the surface by it, and sets minimum and maximum values that affect coloring the surface.

Parameters:
filename - file, url or relative location to the codebase
surfacetype - one of the following strings: "van der Waals", "Solvent-accessible", "Connolly", "Blobby"
min - vertices having equal or lesser values will be colored as minimum
max - vertices having equal or greater values will be colored as maximum

mapPropertyFile

public void mapPropertyFile(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String surfacetype,
                            float min,
                            float max,
                            float surfacePrecision)
Computes a Connolly molecular surfaces by the given precision, loads the given property file, colors the surface by it, and sets minimum and maximum values that affect coloring the surface.

Parameters:
filename - file, url or relative location to the codebase
surfacetype - one of the following strings: "van der Waals", "Solvent-accessible", "Connolly", "Blobby"
min - vertices having equal or lesser values will be colored as minimum
max - vertices having equal or greater values will be colored as maximum
surfacePrecision - grid spacing of surface in Angstroms, default value is 0.55

mapPropertyFile

public void mapPropertyFile(java.lang.String filename,
                            float min,
                            float max)
Computes a Connolly molecular surface, loads the given property file, colors the surface by it, and sets minimum and maximum values that affect coloring the surface.

Parameters:
filename - file, url or relative location to the codebase
min - vertices having equal or lesser values will be colored as minimum
max - vertices having equal or greater values will be colored as maximum

mapPropertyFile

public void mapPropertyFile(java.lang.String filename,
                            float min,
                            float max,
                            float surfacePrecision)
Computes a Connolly molecular surface by the given precision, loads the given property file, colors the surface by it, and sets minimum and maximum values that affect coloring the surface.

Parameters:
filename - file, url or relative location to the codebase
min - vertices having equal or lesser values will be colored as minimum
max - vertices having equal or greater values will be colored as maximum
surfacePrecision - grid spacing of surface in Angstroms, default value is 0.55

createSlabComponent

public chemaxon.marvin.space.SlabComponent createSlabComponent()
Creates a SlabComponent, that can be initailized by SlabComponent.beginSlab(), vertices can be set by the SlabComponent.addVertex(float, float, float) method, and finally SlabComponent.endSlab() should be invoked.

Returns:
the created component

createSlabComponent

public chemaxon.marvin.space.SlabComponent createSlabComponent(java.lang.String name)
Creates a SlabComponent, that can be initailized by SlabComponent.beginSlab(), vertices can be set by the SlabComponent.addVertex(float, float, float) method, and finally SlabComponent.endSlab() should be invoked.

Parameters:
name - name of the component
Returns:
the created component

createSlabComponent

public chemaxon.marvin.space.SlabComponent createSlabComponent(java.lang.String name,
                                                               int r,
                                                               int g,
                                                               int b)
Creates a SlabComponent, that can be initailized by SlabComponent.beginSlab(), vertices can be set by the SlabComponent.addVertex(float, float, float) method, and finally SlabComponent.endSlab() should be invoked.

Parameters:
name - name of the component
r - red component of the color
g - green component of the color
b - blue component of the color
Returns:
the created component

createSlabComponent

public chemaxon.marvin.space.SlabComponent createSlabComponent(float[][] vertices)
Creates a SlabComponent with the given vertices. Warning: this function is not working with JavaScript and certain browsers. It is suggested to use the createSlabComponent() method.

Parameters:
vertices - array of xyz coordinate arrays
Returns:
the component that is created

createSlabComponent

public chemaxon.marvin.space.SlabComponent createSlabComponent(float[] vertices)
Creates a SlabComponent with the given vertices. Warning: this function is not working with JavaScript and certain browsers. It is suggested to use the createSlabComponent() method.

Parameters:
vertices - array of x, y, z coordinates
Returns:
the component that is created
